commit_message:
Add missing mock for cinder.default_quota_get

When running tests, I get the following logs:

INFO:requests.packages.urllib3.connectionpool:Starting new HTTP connection (1):
public.nova.example.com

DEBUG:cinderclient.client:Connection refused:
HTTPConnectionPool(host='public.nova.example.com', port=8776): Max retries
exceeded with url: /v1/os-quota-sets/1/defaults (Caused by <class
'socket.gaierror'>: [Errno -2] Name or service not known)

Which signify, that there is a mock missing in the tests.
This patch adds that missing mock.

Change-Id: I4f79f533b729112d11c7165adde2ac751d49f46b
Closes-Bug: #1300141
(cherry picked from commit e019ed140e31f4a25b843429b70c3e28d48a8628)

commit_message:
Make docker image smaller by using Precise

Changing to precise means we don't have both python 3 and 2 installed in
the image, only python 2. Also do some cleanup at the end of the build
since we are exporting the final filesystem, and don't care about the
size of the intermediate layers.

Change-Id: Iac61d4a882aee19214de5dd74bbbaacc8b0f3414

commit_message:
troveclient 1.0.4 released

Needed for Heat:

- support providing datastore type and datastore version when creating
  Trove instance (new feature in Trove Icehouse,
  introduced in troveclient 1.0.4)

- support providing network id when creating Trove instance (needed in
  presence of multiple Neutron networks, introduced in troveclient
  1.0.4)

Change-Id: I476c16ee5419ef5d0a555071b825de897c3cbf5b

commit_message:
Fix py33, make sure skip_on_py3 is part of every check

Reorder skip_on_py3 check in test_doctest so even py27 tests will make
sure skip_on_py3 is defined.

Add skip_on_py3 to base GlobalCheck

Change-Id: I62cd07cf00acde9e0ee19f045358dc3861a918ad

commit_message:
Add noqa everywhere that it is easy to do so

Hacking attempts to standardize the style guide for OpenStack, but
ultimately it is up to each project to accept and enforce each rule.
Going with that, give each project finer grained control over enforcing
each rule and support noqa where possible. This is a change of policy
from only supporting noqa where a clear example was given needing it.

This patch adds noqa support to every check that is easy to do so on.
This attempts to preemptively support noqa, without going out of the
way, as physical line checks don't automatically understand noqa like
logical_line checks.

Add noqa too:
H701
H702
H232
H234
H235
H237

Change-Id: I0ddefdb84854ae61d2f15f20d6e8019f8c34f30a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/hacking refs/changes/70/90270/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Check configdrive size before writing to partition

Avoids writing a configdrive out to disk that is larger than
the intended partition.

Change-Id: I4e067ccb23ba528d96e4faad39219f67b4178e82
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-python-agent refs/changes/90/89390/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ConfigDriveTooLargeError(RESTError): """Error raised when a configdrive is larger than the partition.""" message = 'Configdrive is too large for intended partition.' def __init__(self, filename, filesize): details = ('Configdrive at {0} has size {1}, which is larger than ' 'the intended partition.').format(filename, filesize) super(ConfigDriveTooLargeError, self).__init__(details) self.details = details

commit_message:
Remove H901,H902 since it is a duplicate of H714,H713

In pep8 1.5 H714,H713 was fixed so now H901 is a duplicate of H714 and
H902 is a duplicate of H713. So remove H901 and H902 since we now get
them directly from pep8

Change-Id: Ic01e55781d36328a03692418537b642f1f719d1b

commit_message:
Do not set special_service_provider on RHEL7.

RHEL7 uses systemd and should set this to undef as Fedora does.

Change-Id: Ic9a719dfff50bda85d428fba5d665d7b97d8959c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/82/89682/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 'RedHat': { if ($::operatingsystemmajrelease < 7) { $special_service_provider = 'init' } else { $special_service_provider = undef } }

subject: Fixed database service resource
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-23 21:35:44.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/db/mysql.pp'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat/commit/d1f32f72a05b3594b57f1072100e19cd12f09711', 'message': 'Fixed database service resource

Version 2.2+ of the puppetlabs-mysql moudule starts the MySQL database
with the Service resource name mysqld [1]. The puppet-heat module
lists a requirement for a Service resource with name mysql. This will
lead to an undefined resource error.

This patch corrects the dependency.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/server/service.pp#L15

Change-Id: I2f60b610eab4d03552352108d0dfd4f2b796fc70
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed database service resource

Version 2.2+ of the puppetlabs-mysql moudule starts the MySQL database
with the Service resource name mysqld [1]. The puppet-heat module
lists a requirement for a Service resource with name mysql. This will
lead to an undefined resource error.

This patch corrects the dependency.

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-mysql/blob/master/manifests/server/service.pp#L15

Change-Id: I2f60b610eab4d03552352108d0dfd4f2b796fc70
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/40/89940/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require => Service['mysqld'],

commit_message:
Worked on Fedora 20 examples in HOT

Fixed the image names in hot/F20/WordPress_Native.yaml to match what
DevStack will do with date-independent configuration.  Adapted the
2-instance WordPress example.
Turned off SELinux where it hurts.

Change-Id: I373700de873e6e375622ab65bd4a175af96d217f
Partial-Bug: #1305425

subject: Software config hook to provision using shell scripts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-31 05:05:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat-templates/commit/396608439acbc3786f615a6858de5b0d69fd1136', 'message': 'Software config hook to provision using shell scripts

Deployment input values are mapped to shell environment variables.
Scripts can write output values to $heat_outputs_path.{output_name}
These output values will be signalled back to heat, making these
values available to the stack, and placing that deployment resource in a
COMPLETE state.

The example template demonstrates deploying a single config with more
that one deployment resource, each with different input values.

The only reason this is the first hook to be authored is because
a script is a "configuration tool" which requires no tooling to
set up.

Change-Id: Ib297957ad0f89e34b7930ba97886116bff1e313c

commit_message:
Software config hook to provision using shell scripts

Deployment input values are mapped to shell environment variables.
Scripts can write output values to $heat_outputs_path.{output_name}
These output values will be signalled back to heat, making these
values available to the stack, and placing that deployment resource in a
COMPLETE state.

The example template demonstrates deploying a single config with more
that one deployment resource, each with different input values.

The only reason this is the first hook to be authored is because
a script is a "configuration tool" which requires no tooling to
set up.

Closes-Bug: #1279064

Change-Id: Ib297957ad0f89e34b7930ba97886116bff1e313c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-templates refs/changes/97/70297/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python import json import logging import os import requests import subprocess import sys EXE_DIR = os.environ.get('HEAT_SHELL_EXECUTION', '/var/lib/heat-config/heat-config-script') OUTPUTS_DIR = os.environ.get('HEAT_SHELL_OUTPUTS', '/var/run/heat-config/heat-config-script') CONF_FILE = os.environ.get('HEAT_SHELL_CONFIG', '/etc/heat-config/heat-config-script') def prepare_dir(path): if not os.path.isdir(path): os.makedirs(path, 0o755) for fn in os.listdir(path): os.remove(os.path.join(path, fn)) def main(argv=sys.argv): log = logging.getLogger('heat-config-script') handler = logging.StreamHandler(sys.stderr) handler.setFormatter( logging.Formatter( '[%(asctime)s] (%(name)s) [%(levelname)s] %(message)s')) log.addHandler(handler) log.setLevel('DEBUG') if not os.path.exists(CONF_FILE): log.error('No config file %s' % CONF_FILE) return 1 prepare_dir(EXE_DIR) prepare_dir(OUTPUTS_DIR) config = json.load(open(CONF_FILE)) for seq, c in enumerate(config): env = os.environ.copy() for input in c['inputs']: input_name = input['name'] env[input_name] = c.get('input_values', {}).get(input_name, '') log.info('%s=%s' % (input_name, env[input_name])) fn = '%s/%02d-%s' % (EXE_DIR, seq, c['id']) heat_outputs_path = '%s/%02d-%s' % (OUTPUTS_DIR, seq, c['id']) env['heat_outputs_path'] = heat_outputs_path with open(fn, 'a') as f: f.write(c.get('config', '')) os.chmod(fn, 0o755) try: log.debug('Running %s' % fn) subprocess.check_call([fn], env=env, close_fds=True) sys.stdout.flush() sys.stderr.flush() log.info('Completed %s' % fn) except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: log.error("Error running %s. [%s]\n" % (fn, e)) log.error("Aborting...") return 1 response = {} for output in c['outputs']: output_name = output['name'] try: with open('%s.%s' % (heat_outputs_path, output_name)) as out: response[output_name] = out.read() except IOError: pass signal_data = json.dumps(response) log.debug('Signalling %s to %s' % (signal_data, c['signal_id'])) r = requests.post(c['signal_id'], data=signal_data) log.debug('Response %s ' % r) if __name__ == '__main__': sys.exit(main(sys.argv))

added_lines: ============================ Software configuration hooks ============================ This directory contains `diskimage-builder <https://github.com/openstack/diskimage-builder>`_ elements to build an image which contains the software configuration hook required to use your preferred configuration method. These elements depend on some elements found in the `tripleo-image-elements <https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-image-elements>`_ repository. These elements will build an image which uses `os-collect-config <https://github.com/openstack/os-collect-config>`_, `os-refresh-config <https://github.com/openstack/os-refresh-config>`_, and `os-apply-config <https://github.com/openstack/os-apply-config>`_ together to invoke a hook with the supplied configuration data, and return any outputs back to heat. When building an image, the heat-config element is required, along with the elements for the hooks which enable the preferred configuration methods. An example fedora based image containing all hooks can be built and uploaded to glance with the following: :: git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/diskimage-builder.git git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements.git git clone https://git.openstack.org/openstack/heat-templates.git export ELEMENTS_PATH=tripleo-image-elements/elements:heat-templates/hot/software-config/elements diskimage-builder/bin/disk-image-create vm \ fedora \ heat-config \ os-collect-config \ os-refresh-config \ os-apply-config \ heat-config-cfn-init \ heat-config-puppet \ heat-config-script \ -o fedora-software-config.qcow2 glance image-create --disk-format qcow2 --container-format bare --name fedora-software-config < \ fedora-software-config.qcow2

added_lines: heat_template_version: 2013-05-23 description: > This template demonstrates how to use OS::Heat::StructuredDeployment to override substitute get_input placeholders defined in OS::Heat::StructuredConfig config. As there is no hook on the server to act on the configuration data, these deployment resource will perform no actual configuration. parameters: key_name: type: string flavor: type: string image: type: string default: fedora-software-config resources: the_sg: type: OS::Neutron::SecurityGroup properties: name: the_sg description: Ping and SSH rules: - protocol: icmp - protocol: tcp port_range_min: 22 port_range_max: 22 config: type: OS::Heat::StructuredConfig properties: config: config_value_foo: {get_input: foo} config_value_bar: {get_input: bar} deployment: type: OS::Heat::StructuredDeployment properties: wait_for_signal: false config: get_resource: config server: get_resource: server input_values: foo: fooooo bar: baaaaa other_deployment: type: OS::Heat::StructuredDeployment properties: wait_for_signal: false config: get_resource: config server: get_resource: server input_values: foo: fu bar: barmy server: type: OS::Nova::Server properties: image: {get_param: image} flavor: {get_param: flavor} key_name: {get_param: key_name} security_groups: - {get_resource: the_sg} user_data_format: SOFTWARE_CONFIG

commit_message:
Software config hook to provision using cfn-init

This hook uses heat-cfntools cfn_helper as a lib and loads the
metadata directly, then invokes the cfn_init directly.

Change-Id: Iebc184a0fa65eb6424df8f751cb172186c9ec30e
Closes-Bug: #1279065

commit_message:
Software config hook to provision using puppet

Deployment input values are mapped to facter variables by setting
FACTER_<input name> shell environment variables.
Manifests can write output values to $heat_outputs_path.{output_name}
These output values will be signalled back to heat, making these
values available to the stack, and placing that deployment resource in a
COMPLETE state.

The example template demonstrates deploying a single config with more
that one deployment resource, each with different input values.

Closes-Bug: #1279067

Change-Id: I28057eaa478b0a480f09604c177a72f3c45d7c53
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-templates refs/changes/39/70639/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/usr/bin/env python import json import logging import os import requests import subprocess import sys EXE_DIR = os.environ.get('HEAT_PUPPET_EXECUTION', '/var/lib/heat-config/heat-config-puppet') OUTPUTS_DIR = os.environ.get('HEAT_PUPPET_OUTPUTS', '/var/run/heat-config/heat-config-puppet') CONF_FILE = os.environ.get('HEAT_PUPPET_CONFIG', '/etc/heat-config/heat-config-puppet') def prepare_dir(path): if not os.path.isdir(path): os.makedirs(path, 0o755) for fn in os.listdir(path): os.remove(os.path.join(path, fn)) def main(argv=sys.argv): log = logging.getLogger('heat-config-puppet') handler = logging.StreamHandler(sys.stderr) handler.setFormatter( logging.Formatter( '[%(asctime)s] (%(name)s) [%(levelname)s] %(message)s')) log.addHandler(handler) log.setLevel('DEBUG') if not os.path.exists(CONF_FILE): log.error('No config file %s' % CONF_FILE) return 1 prepare_dir(EXE_DIR) prepare_dir(OUTPUTS_DIR) config = json.load(open(CONF_FILE)) for seq, c in enumerate(config): env = os.environ.copy() for input in c['inputs']: input_name = input['name'] fact_name = 'FACTER_%s' % input_name env[fact_name] = c.get('input_values', {}).get(input_name, '') log.info('%s=%s' % (input_name, env[fact_name])) fn = '%s/%02d-%s.pp' % (EXE_DIR, seq, c['id']) heat_outputs_path = '%s/%02d-%s' % (OUTPUTS_DIR, seq, c['id']) env['FACTER_heat_outputs_path'] = heat_outputs_path with open(fn, 'a') as f: f.write(c.get('config', '')) try: cmd = ['puppet', 'apply', fn] log.debug('Running %s' % ' '.join(cmd)) subprocess.check_call(cmd, env=env, close_fds=True) sys.stdout.flush() sys.stderr.flush() log.info('Completed %s' % fn) except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e: log.error("Error running %s. [%s]\n" % (fn, e)) log.error("Aborting...") return 1 response = {} for output in c['outputs']: output_name = output['name'] try: with open('%s.%s' % (heat_outputs_path, output_name)) as out: response[output_name] = out.read() except IOError: pass signal_data = json.dumps(response) log.debug('Signalling %s to %s' % (signal_data, c['signal_id'])) r = requests.post(c['signal_id'], data=signal_data) log.debug('Response %s ' % r) if __name__ == '__main__': sys.exit(main(sys.argv))

subject: os-refresh-config script to invoke config hooks

This orc script takes a list of heat config metadata under
the "deployments" key and invokes a hook for each config item.

Hooks are stored in /var/lib/heat-config/hooks and the config group
name is used to specify which hook script to invoke.

A hook receives the config JSON on stdin and writes an outputs JSON
dict to stdout. The orc script takes the outputs dict and signals
that back to heat using either a cfn signal post or a heatclient
resource-signal library call.

The following changes in this series contain hook implementations
and example templates.

commit_message:
os-refresh-config script to invoke config hooks

This orc script takes a list of heat config metadata under
the 'deployments' key and invokes a hook for each config item.

Hooks are stored in /var/lib/heat-config/hooks and the config group
name is used to specify which hook script to invoke.

A hook receives the config JSON on stdin and writes a JSON dict containing
outputs data to stdout. The orc script takes the outputs dict and signals
that back to heat using either a cfn signal post or a heatclient
resource-signal library call.

The following changes in this series contain hook implementations
and example templates.

Change-Id: Ia02005c28d550a195771dfacbba5fd71a39db709

commit_message:
Install and use diskimage-builder, tripleo-image-elements

- install diskimage-builder and tripleo-image-elements from pip
- add workaround for pip issue which is fixed in the next pip release
- add missing heat setup_develop call
- add a check for successful disk-image-create

Change-Id: I10d5d7e9fa660919d36614ef6af4474e1d945b52

commit_message:
Clean oslo dependencies files

Modules py3kcompat, flakes, test and setup are no longer available
or needed.

The modules install_venv_common and config are now synced as scripts.

Change-Id: I2da06cb3599c6ba2ec736789d48679d38d4150c6

commit_message:
Fix some warnings and some refactoring

Other warnings I cannon fix yet and they can be ignored:

* "WARNING: duplicate label" This is because index files are duplicated
  between pdf and html sets. Excludes should fix it, but don't do
  it entirely. These indices should be refactored somehow.

* "WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree" Pdf build don't use
  single doctree and neigher excludes not :orphan: are not effective.

* "is too wide for the frame, rescaling" I don't know why would someone
  make this a warning. It's normal to rescale large images to fit the
  page width during the build process.

* "WARNING: undefined label" Cross references between pdf files obviously
  will not work. But will work inside a single html doctree.

I have also moves all index file includes into contents/ so both PDF and
HTML builds include same files and you only need to edit one index file
inside contents/ folder to make changes to both pdf and html.

Change-Id: Ia1a6e3e1f7026005702b06fd704822076d163997
Closes-Bug: 1310555

commit_message:
incloud CIDR can overlap custom baremetal-network

If you are using the custom baremetal-network capability it's
possible to overlap the incloud CIDR (10.0.0.0/8), however it's not
possible to set that to something else as it's statically coded
into the devtest_overcloud script.

This patch checks the testenv.json file for a custom INCLOUD_CIDR
and defaults back to 10.0.0.0/8 if one isn't found

Change-Id: I4038a7f8c59a86873696916dd3495f20b1ed35c3
Closes-Bug: 1302881

commit_message:
support for managing ssh keys

This change permits provisioning ssh public and private keys as part of
creating the "nova" user.  There are no changes to the default behavior
of the module.  This changes introduces three new parameters:

- nova_public_key
- nova_private_key
- nova_shell

These changes are intended to permit configuring live migration via
qemu+ssh connections to remote hypervisors.

Change-Id: Ib61f4574843a7e5ada9a08692f4488cb844c9eee
Implements: blueprint provision-ssh-keys

commit_message:
VMware: Log additional details of suds faults

When a suds requests results in a fault response, the current
code loses details on that fault in the sequence of exceptions
propagated through the driver.  A NoPermission fault will contain
additional metadata on the privilegeId and object type which
needs to be logged.  The fault string will be propagated with this
fix, along with details of a NoPermission fault.

An example of the new exception:
NoPermissionException: Permission to perform this operation was denied.
{u'privilegeId': Resource.AssignVMToPool, u'object': domain-c7}

An example of new exception within retrieveproperties_fault_checker:
Error(s) NoPermission occurred in the call to RetrievePropertiesEx
{'privilegeId': System.Read, 'object': datacenter-16}

Change-Id: Iafbf052750c2835f304b2edf21d7300d1fbd7e5a
Closes-bug: #1289627

commit_message:
Replace X with check marks

This changeset replaces the character "X" with a check mark for the
table "Additional Security Features" in chapter "40. Hypervisor
Selection" of the security-guide.

It is inspired by ch_arch_storage.xml in the OpenStack operations-guide,
but puts the entity declaration into a separate, new file in
doc/common/entities where it can be referenced as a parameter entity
in all manuals that need it.

Change-Id: Iea8d82163d11eb2cf5b7e4f086a530de2c06f350

commit_message:
Adds CA cert file path option for glance connections

Currently, there is no way to pass CA cert for HTTPS glance
connections. This patch adds new nova.conf option to enable
secure connection.

Closes-Bug: #1299841
DocImpact - New option added to nova.conf

Change-Id: Id751fad65685ef1c75555e21497200027f3f11d4
(cherry picked from commit 84e2d9040f17697d1a404bb81c9141f9733a848f)

commit_message:
Adds CA cert file path option for glance connections

Currently, there is no way to pass CA cert for HTTPS glance
connections. This patch adds new nova.conf option to enable
secure connection.

Closes-Bug: #1299841
DocImpact - New option added to nova.conf

Change-Id: I6fc055030702eef7d27b89fa52d427190aee295c

commit_message:
Move all cinder-common tests into cinder-common_spec

The cinder.conf template resource exists in the cinder-common recipe,
and therefore all tests for that template should sit in the cinder-common_spec

Also, this removes a duplicated test that was in both (syslog config)

Change-Id: I00add345d961eb4502ec9dc9a3b8e7b29096ff7c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-block-storage refs/changes/11/90711/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: describe 'cinder.conf' do let(:file) { chef_run.template('/etc/cinder/cinder.conf') } it 'runs logging recipe if node attributes say to' do node.set['openstack']['block-storage']['syslog']['use'] = true expect(chef_run).to render_file(file.name).with_content('log_config = /etc/openstack/logging.conf') end context 'rdb driver' do before do node.set['openstack']['block-storage']['volume'] = { 'driver' => 'cinder.volume.drivers.rbd.RBDDriver' } end # FIXME(galstrom21): this block needs to check all of the default # rdb_* configuration options it 'has default rbd_* options set' do expect(chef_run).to render_file(file.name).with_content(/^rbd_/) expect(chef_run).not_to render_file(file.name).with_content(/^netapp_/) end end context 'netapp driver' do before do node.set['openstack']['block-storage']['volume'] = { 'driver' => 'cinder.volume.drivers.netapp.NetAppISCSIDriver' } end # FIXME(galstrom21): this block needs to check all of the default # netapp_* configuration options it 'has default netapp_* options set' do expect(chef_run).to render_file(file.name).with_content(/^netapp_/) expect(chef_run).not_to render_file(file.name).with_content(/^rbd_/) end end end

commit_message:
WIP: Ensure objects are passed over RPC

We'll use Pickle here to start, as it "just works". But we should
replace this once we have schemas attached to the objects, allowing
for more intelligent serialization and cross component verisioning.

Untested.

Change-Id: Ia14356989033b201b47aa46558a0eca5d962ffd9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/49/90549/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from designate.openstack.common import importutils# cPickle is much much faster pickle = importutils.try_import('cPickle') if pickle is None: import pickle class PicklePayloadSerializer(messaging.NoOpSerializer): @staticmethod def serialize_entity(self, context, entity): return pickle.dumps(entity) @staticmethod def deserialize_entity(self, context, entity): return pickle.loads(entity) if serializer is None: serializer = PicklePayloadSerializer() if serializer is None: serializer = PicklePayloadSerializer()

commit_message:
Deploy fuel node with docker containers

DO NOT MERGE PLS. Work in progress.

We need to put fuel-images.tar.lbz and fuel-dockerctl.tgz on the
ISO and use them in bootstrap_admin_node.sh script.

blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services

Change-Id: Ic57f06bb3534c3e839a39918734018652408bb5d

commit_message:
Check for None or timestamp in availability zone api sample

test_availability_zone_detail depends on the services not having an
updated_at time set in the database.  This is set by a periodic task so
it's not guaranteed to be set, or not, shortly after the service starts.
On a fast system the test reliably passes, but adding a delay causes the
test to start failing.  Introducing a time.sleep(5) in the test seems to
make it reliably fail for me.  The test should pass if updated_at is set
to None or a timestamp.

Change-Id: I976ddf5354a52ca06a6419a92abcacb7d2379a37
Closes-bug: 1300810

commit_message:
compute.rpcapi: remove havana compat

Remove havana compatibility code from the compute rpcapi.  This was
some special case code needed to retain live upgrade capability from
havana to icehouse because the compute rpc api was given a major
version bump during icehouse development.  We've sinced refined our
rpc major version bump process to avoid having to do this in the
future.

Now that we're in Juno, this code can be dropped.

Change-Id: I2cd3d08eca8fddbc8228c3f279c87bf99e1f4c25

subject: Update HACKING.rst for nova.db import rule
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-08 14:37:33.000000000', 'files': ['HACKING.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3580d75942167683af0940222248223089a1eae5', 'message': 'Update HACKING.rst for nova.db import rule

Now that nova.compute and nova.network are converted to using objects,
update the hacking guide to point out that nova.db imports are not
allowed in those components.

Change-Id: Idacdcb147c777fa37583c0dc4e4a254445067fce
'}]
commit_message:
Update HACKING.rst for nova.db import rule

Now that nova.compute and nova.network are converted to using objects,
update the hacking guide to point out that nova.db imports are not
allowed in those components.

Change-Id: Idacdcb147c777fa37583c0dc4e4a254445067fce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/47/86047/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - ``nova.db`` imports are not allowed in: ``nova/compute/*`` ``nova/network/*`` ``nova/virt/*``

commit_message:
Fix federation mapping rules examples.

There are minor nits in the mapping rules examples, like missing comma
or redundant attribute in the request body.

Change-Id: I7301d99b7466b747c412b97266618bc9b1781812

Creating docker container images during iso build, put them on the
ISO, deploy fuel node with containers.

New variables added to config.mk:
DOCKER_PREBUILT
DOCKER_PREBUILT_SOURCE

They determine if we should build containers during "make iso" or
just download/copy them from some prebuilt source. Please see
config.mk for more details.

Variable PRODUCTION determines the way we build ISO:
  - "docker": build iso with docker containers
  - "prod" and "dev": build iso without containers

Depends on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/90087/

blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services

commit_message:
makefile for docker container build process

Creating docker container images during iso build, put them on the
ISO, deploy fuel node with containers.

New variables added to config.mk:
PRODUCTION
DOCKER_PREBUILT
DOCKER_PREBUILT_SOURCE

They determine if we should build containers during "make iso" or
just download/copy them from some prebuilt source. Please see
config.mk for more details.

Variable PRODUCTION determines the way we build ISO:
  - "docker": build iso with docker containers
  - "prod" and "dev": build iso without containers

Modifies workflow to tell automated scripts when
deployment is complete from completion of puppet
run to "Fuel node deployment complete!"

Depends on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/90087/

blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services

Change-Id: Iae6b77909e78f3f617623a7a3022ce53895dab9a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/80/88280/33 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines:
FROM centos MAINTAINER Aleksandr Didenko adidenko@mirantis.com WORKDIR /root RUN rm -rf /etc/yum.repos.d/* RUN echo -e "[nailgun]
name=Nailgun Local Repo
baseurl=http://$(/sbin/ip route | awk '/default/ { print $3 }'):8080/centos/fuelweb/x86_64/
gpgcheck=0" > /etc/yum.repos.d/nailgun.repo RUN yum clean all RUN yum --quiet install -y ruby21-puppet RUN yum --quiet install -y rabbitmq-server ADD etc /etc RUN mkdir -p /var/lib/hiera && touch /var/lib/hiera/common.yaml; mkdir -p /var/log/rabbitmq RUN /usr/bin/puppet apply -v /etc/puppet/modules/nailgun/examples/rabbitmq-only.pp ADD start.sh /usr/local/bin/start.sh RUN chmod +x /usr/local/bin/start.sh EXPOSE 4369 EXPOSE 5672 EXPOSE 15672 EXPOSE 61613 CMD ["/usr/local/bin/start.sh"]

commit_message:
Added volume_types to DB

Added volume_types table.
Added volume_type column to shares table.
Added migration.
Added db.api methods to manage volume types

Change-Id: I26fd7a1f1f670f95f7a92f7959faa3f5a9dbbfb4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/75/87975/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class InvalidVolumeType(Invalid): message = _("Invalid volume type: %(reason)s") class VolumeTypeNotFound(NotFound): message = _("Volume type %(volume_type_id)s could not be found.") class VolumeTypeNotFoundByName(VolumeTypeNotFound): message = _("Volume type with name %(volume_type_name)s " "could not be found.") class VolumeTypeExtraSpecsNotFound(NotFound): message = _("Volume Type %(volume_type_id)s has no extra specs with " "key %(extra_specs_key)s.") class VolumeTypeInUse(ManilaException): message = _("Volume Type %(volume_type_id)s deletion is not allowed with " "volumes present with the type.") class VolumeTypeExists(Duplicate): message = _("Volume Type %(id)s already exists.") class VolumeTypeEncryptionExists(Invalid): message = _("Volume type encryption for type %(type_id)s already exists.") class VolumeTypeEncryptionNotFound(NotFound): message = _("Volume type encryption for type %(type_id)s does not exist.") class VolumeTypeCreateFailed(ManilaException): message = _("Cannot create volume_type with " "name %(name)s and specs %(extra_specs)s") class ManageExistingVolumeTypeMismatch(ManilaException): message = _("Manage existing volume failed due to volume type mismatch: " "%(reason)s")

commit_message:
Obtain master mac addres from config

Nailgun will be containerized therefore master mac can not be
obtained in run time from host, and needs to be configured
by fuelmenu and puppet on deploy

Change-Id: Ice00270d9874ed7ff8383186f3d4811f2ec091b5
Related-Bug: #1304521

commit_message:
Cleanup hacking doc generation

* Delete old layout files now that we use oslosphinx
* Add fail to build on warning
* Add 'tox -edoc' command (just like nova-specs, keystone, heat etc)

Change-Id: I316c4bb3fe7036ecd8a0fb19d7348c307c0afebe

commit_message:
Fix bypassed reference to node state values

The nova.virt.ironic driver was bypassing the defined set of node
states and using a literal value. This fixes it to reference the
proper state.

Change-Id: I1f61d1be2e86f659b903c2376233427c0778c38a

commit_message:
Deploy fuel-dockerctl tools via puppet

Docketctl is needed for docker containers deployment and
management.

Also updated nailgun/examples/host-only.pp manifest to make it
deploy supervisord in the way we need it for proper work of
docker containers.

Related to: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/88280/

blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services

Change-Id: Ib929c1263a887efef766552588ba3716daa7d790
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/87/90087/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [program:docker-rsyslog] command=dockerctl start rsyslog --attach numprocs=1 numprocs_start=0 priority=80 autostart=true autorestart=true startsecs=10 startretries=1000000 exitcodes=0,2 stopsignal=INT stopwaitsecs=60 redirect_stderr=true stdout_logfile=/var/log/%(program_name)s.log stdout_logfile_maxbytes=50MB stdout_logfile_backups=10 stdout_capture_maxbytes=0 stdout_events_enabled=false stderr_logfile=/var/log/%(program_name)s-err.log stderr_logfile_maxbytes=50MB stderr_logfile_backups=10 stderr_capture_maxbytes=0 stderr_events_enabled=false serverurl=AUTO

subject: Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-24 11:02:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-block-storage/commit/3bf93c47bbd2245b20ab3eca59e3bb19134ee436', 'message': 'Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP

Sometimes you want the actual endpoint IP to be a load balanced IP, but
the bind IP to be a local IP (different per node).

This change allows that by using attributes from the [block-storage-api-bind] namespace

Implements blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I79ca114d2d78caaf101357e1400aa046c9943956

commit_message:
Allow binding locally to different IP than endpoint IP

Sometimes you want the actual endpoint IP to be a load balanced IP, but
the bind IP to be a local IP (different per node).

This change allows that by using attributes from the [block-storage-api-bind] namespace

Implements blueprint increase-ip-binding-flexibility

Change-Id: I79ca114d2d78caaf101357e1400aa046c9943956
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cookbook-openstack-block-storage refs/changes/56/90056/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The following attributes are defined in attributes/default.rb of the common cookbook, but are documented here due to their relevance: * `openstack['endpoints']['block-storage-api-bind']['host']` - The IP address to bind the api service to * `openstack['endpoints']['block-storage-api-bind']['port']` - The port to bind the api service to * `openstack['endpoints']['block-storage-api-bind']['bind_interface']` - The interface name to bind the api service to If the value of the 'bind_interface' attribute is non-nil, then the block-storage service will be bound to the first IP address on that interface. If the value of the 'bind_interface' attribute is nil, then the block-storage service will be bound to the IP address specified in the host attribute.

commit_message:
Remove plan datamodel in API layer

Plan datamodel is not needed anymore since the plan controller
will directly POST, PUT and GET the plan in Swift.

Change-Id: I0104c5bb1ba17c6bc1911b90d705606219fad320
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/31/89831/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # Copyright 2014 - Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import uuid import wsme from wsme.rest import json as wjson from wsme import types as wtypes from solum.api.controllers.v1.datamodel import types as api_types class Requirement(wtypes.Base): requirement_type = wtypes.text "Type of requirement." fulfillment = wtypes.text "The ID of the service." class ServiceReference(wtypes.Base): name = wtypes.text "The name of the service to be used." id = wtypes.text "The ID of the service to be used." characteristics = [wtypes.text] "A list of characteristics required from the service." class Artifact(wtypes.Base): """Artifact.""" name = wtypes.text "Name of the artifact." artifact_type = wtypes.text "Type of artifact." content = {wtypes.text: wtypes.text} "Type specific content as a flat dict." language_pack = wtypes.text "The Language pack required for this artifact." requirements = [Requirement] "List of requirements for the artifact." def __init__(self, **kwargs): if 'requirements' in kwargs: kwargs['requirements'] = [Requirement(**re) for re in kwargs.get('requirements', [])] super(Artifact, self).__init__(**kwargs) class Plan(api_types.Base): """Representation of an Plan file. The Plan resource is a representation of a Plan file. Plans are used to create Assembly resources. A Plan resource may be used to create an arbitrary number of Assembly instances. They use artifacts and services to indicate what will be used to generate the plan, and what services Solum can use to satisfy them. Note: Plan files are YAML and Plan resources are the REST representation of the Plan file after services have been matched to ones offered by Solum. """ artifacts = [Artifact] """List of artifacts defining the plan.""" services = [ServiceReference] """List of services needed by the plan.""" def __init__(self, **kwargs): if 'artifacts' in kwargs: kwargs['artifacts'] = [Artifact(**art) for art in kwargs.get('artifacts', [])] if 'services' in kwargs: kwargs['services'] = [ServiceReference(**sr) for sr in kwargs.get('services', [])] super(Plan, self).__init__(**kwargs) @classmethod def sample(cls): return cls(uri='http://example.com/v1/plans/x1', name='Example plan', type='plan', tags=['small'], artifacts=[{ 'name': 'My python app', 'artifact_type': 'git_pull', 'content': {'href': 'git://example.com/project.git'}, 'language_pack': str(uuid.uuid4()), 'requirements': [{ 'requirement_type': 'git_pull', 'fulfillment': 'id:build'}]}], services=[{ 'name': 'Build Service', 'id': 'build', 'characteristics': ['python_build_service']}], project_id='1dae5a09ef2b4d8cbf3594b0eb4f6b94', user_id='55f41cf46df74320b9486a35f5d28a11', description='A plan with no services or artifacts shown') @classmethod def from_db_model(cls, m, host_url): json = m.as_dict() json['type'] = m.__tablename__ json['uri'] = '%s/v1/%s/%s' % (host_url, m.__resource__, m.uuid) if m.raw_content is not None: json.update(m.raw_content) del json['id'] return cls(**(json)) def as_dict(self, db_model): base = super(Plan, self).as_dict(db_model) if self.artifacts is not wsme.Unset: base.update({'artifacts': [wjson.tojson(Artifact, art) for art in self.artifacts]}) if self.services is not wsme.Unset: base.update({'services': [wjson.tojson(ServiceReference, ref) for ref in self.services]}) return base

Remove Plan object in database layer

Plan db object is not needed anymore since we will store the plan in swift.
Replaced Plan FK in Assembly by plan_uri field

subject: Store the plan in Swift
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-23 13:21:02.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/solum/commit/f47ba2f9fae00343b05ac80be3d68e620c114257', 'message': "Store the plan in Swift

* Plan POST method now stores the the plan file in Swift
* Plans will be available in Swift in the Container 'plans', Container uri:
http://{STORAGE_URL}/{TENANT_ID}/plans

commit_message:
Store the plan in Swift

* Plan POST method now stores the the plan file in Swift
* Plans will be available in Swift in the Container 'plans', Container uri:
http://{STORAGE_URL}/{TENANT_ID}/plans
* Temporary disabled Plan functionnal test and will re-enable them
once add-plan-in-swift is complete.

Change-Id: I7340efb011c7f261c26a761613e4f9ddbfed5e9c
Closes-Bug: #1276905

commit_message:
Debian element should activate eth0

Cloud images expect the primary interface to run dhclient in order
to come up and acquire an IP address. Although we have technology
to manage without this for the undercloud and so on, the seed
still relies on this machinery in order to bring up its first
interface.

Change-Id: I079a679779de760ee9ca6f93cbb22e69a65e03af

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "update grenade branches""

We are not gating on n-cpu-partial so it's safe to propose
icehouse -> master grenade upgrades.

This reverts commit 633b702cd9ac62d9fba15f60c20423844b4949b5.

Change-Id: If6f18f86f0f5a2dccd02fb82452c8651436cc5d2

commit_message:
Make time out 60 mins like the Heat default.

Make the overcloud create timeout match that of the Heat default
(60 mins for the Heat stack-create), as on slow networks with real
hardware the set-up time can be slow. Also if the stack-create
fails the loop will exit so this change should be harmless.

Change-Id: I5641aab4d69ba92dea81f06bdda51d46a113e814

commit_message:
Add scenario testing support

Adding infrastructure to support standalone scenario testing
for Climate.

To make it happen, we had to mimic the way that tempest was
handling the scenario tests and since we weren't allow to modify
tempest code, we built a similar hierachy (check manager and scenario
classes and their parents).
As long for the config_resource_reservation file, we added some
params to handle the timeout checks

The test added follow these steps:
    1) Create an instance with the hint parameters
      * start_date: now + 1 minute
      * end_date: start_date + 3 minutes
    2) check vm was shelved
    3) check vm became active
    4) check that a new lease is created on climate
    5) check its param
    6) wait lease end
    7) make sure VM was snapshoted and removed
Test duration: between 3 and 5 minutes

Partially implements: blueprint climate-tempest-testing
Change-Id: I023866ec8f19cfa8fec16c8fb9af4ed014160fe0

commit_message:
Client support for before_end_notification parameter

Adding a new parameter called "before_end_notification" to both
lease-create and lease-update commands. This new parameter will allow
to modify the timeof the "before_end_lease" event.
The parameter will accept an elapsed time as argument (similar to the
prolong-for option) but with the restriction that only arguments greater
than 3600 secs (one hour) will be allowed.

Partially implements: blueprint before-end-notification-crud
Change-Id: I56bfe937c6e0da6654d6b2b02dfd23339ab218f1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-blazarclient refs/changes/37/89837/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from climateclient import utils def create(self, name, start, end, reservations, events, before_end_notification): if before_end_notification: seconds = \ utils.from_elapsed_time_to_seconds(before_end_notification) if seconds < 3600: raise exception.ClimateClientException(_("Invalid argument " "for before-end. " "Min value is " "3600 seconds " "(one hour)")) else: delta_sec = datetime.timedelta(seconds=seconds) cur_end_date = \ datetime.datetime.strptime(values['end_date'], '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M') new_before_end_date = cur_end_date - delta_sec values['before_end_notification'] = datetime.datetime.strftime( new_before_end_date, '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M' ) """Creates lease from values passed.""" def update(self, lease_id, name=None, prolong_for=None, before_end_notification=None): if before_end_notification: seconds = \ utils.from_elapsed_time_to_seconds(before_end_notification) if seconds < 3600: raise exception.ClimateClientException(_("Invalid argument " "for before-end. commit_message:
Fixes bug in scheduler filter for Sahara

Introducing schedulers in Nova compute competes with Sahara filters.
Added logic verifies if Sahara is enabled to add some required filters

Closes-Bug: 1312790

Change-Id: I7c74904483ecee8174550c50d9122338e0e38c5a

commit_message:
Better setup for custom Java installation

Fix bug #1305904 (ownership of java files)
Add Java to the PATH and setup the JAVA_HOME env variable
Setup alternatives for java executables

closes-bug: #1305904

Change-Id: I18b87b4eac44b8a5f303dc5d06f268506c7ed300
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara-image-elements refs/changes/15/89515/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: distro=$(lsb_release -is || :) echo "Decompressing Java archive" echo -e "\n" | tar -zxf $JAVA_FILE JAVA_NAME=`ls -1 /usr/java/ | grep -v tar.gz` echo "Setting up $JAVA_NAME" chown -R root:root $JAVA_HOME cat >> /etc/profile.d/java.sh <<EOF # Custom Java install export JAVA_HOME=/usr/java/$JAVA_NAME export PATH=\$PATH:/usr/java/$JAVA_NAME/bin EOF case "$distro" in Ubuntu ) echo "Setting up alternatives for Java" update-alternatives --install "/usr/bin/java" "java" "/usr/java/$JAVA_NAME/bin/java" 1 update-alternatives --install "/usr/bin/javac" "javac" "/usr/java/$JAVA_NAME/bin/javac" 1 update-alternatives --install "/usr/bin/javaws" "javaws" "/usr/java/$JAVA_NAME/bin/javaws" 1 update-alternatives --set java /usr/java/$JAVA_NAME/bin/java update-alternatives --set javac /usr/java/$JAVA_NAME/bin/javac update-alternatives --set javaws /usr/java/$JAVA_NAME/bin/javaws ;; esac

commit_message:
Expose dnsmasq options

Adds a new parameter, NeutronDnsmasqOptions, to the overcloud template.

Allows the ability to set dnsmasq options for neutron dhcp agent. This
will allow us to configure mtu to be 1400 for tenant instances on the
overcloud.  This should help with poor network performance and vm's that
are just plain unreachable via ssh due to the GRE tunnel overhead.

The default here has been set to:
dhcp-option-force=26,1400

This is the recommended way to configure OpenStack with the Open vSwitch
plugin per:
http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/content/openvswitch_plugin.html

All the documentation I can find on the web (openstack-dev,
ask.openstack.org, etc), recommend applying this setting. Others have
reported slow vm performance as well, and this resolves that issue
(apparently anyway...we'd need to test).

Change-Id: If24326045987b5a484ba2f71f591092987966536
Partial-Bug: #1270646
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/03/82803/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: NeutronDnsmasqOptions: Default: '' Description: Dnsmasq options for neutron-dhcp-agent Type: String dnsmasq-options: Ref: NeutronDnsmasqOptions

subject: VMware: ensure rescue instance is deleted when...
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-28 11:25:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py', 'nova/virt/vmwareapi/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/f1b7e1b8fadb5a99bd698aebc7c678a908a156fb', 'message': 'VMware: ensure rescue instance is deleted when...

...instance is deleted

Backported fix created by Gary Kotton <gkotton@vmware.com>
https://review.openstack.org/#q,efb66531bc37ee416778a70d46c657608ca767af,n,z

If the user creates a rescue instance and then proceeded to delete
the original instance then the rescue instance would still be up
and running on the backend.

This patch ensures that the rescue instance is cleaned up if
necessary.

The vmops unrescue method has a new parameter indicating if
the original VM should be powered on.

Signed-off-by: Nanuk Krinner <nkrinner@suse.de>
Fixes Bug#1269418

Change-Id: I52845cd81ac6ad20a3ad4a7017891339e968b4cb
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: ensure rescue instance is deleted when...

...instance is deleted

Backported fix created by Gary Kotton <gkotton@vmware.com>
https://review.openstack.org/#q,efb66531bc37ee416778a70d46c657608ca767af,n,z

If the user creates a rescue instance and then proceeded to delete
the original instance then the rescue instance would still be up
and running on the backend.

This patch ensures that the rescue instance is cleaned up if
necessary.

The vmops unrescue method has a new parameter indicating if
the original VM should be powered on.

Signed-off-by: Nanuk Krinner <nkrinner@suse.de>
Fixes Bug#1269418

Change-Id: I52845cd81ac6ad20a3ad4a7017891339e968b4cb

commit_message:
Don't wait for a failed update.

Just as for a failed 'heat stack create', don't wait about if a
'heat stack update' fails.

Change-Id: I49c07666f2555f1b6a072adc707ecb2b879fba6c

commit_message:
Move app package type into separate file

Move murano::application_package type from api.pp to separate file.

Change-Id: I4779b42ae2f021ee957e078bb6a3fcfbeeb8562c
Closes-bug: 1313623
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/86/90686/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: murano::application_package{'io.murano':} Exec['murano_manage_db_sync'] -> Murano::Application_package['io.murano']
deleted_lines: define murano_manage_import_package ( $package_name = '', ) { if $package_name != '' { $package_path="/var/cache/murano/meta/$package_name" exec { 'murano_import_package_io_murano': path => [ '/usr/bin' ], command => "$murano_manage --config-file=/etc/murano/murano.conf import-package '$package_path'", user => $murano_user, group => $murano_user, onlyif => "test -d '$package_path'", } } } murano_manage_import_package{'io.murano':} Exec['murano_manage_db_sync'] -> Murano_manage_import_package['io.murano']

commit_message:
Fix the ceilometer trait-description-list command

command ceilometer trait-description-list is unavailable.

Change-Id: Ib6d03b11194d6a0bef190c815d948649ada6c260
Closes-Bug: #1284548
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/38/76138/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.trait_descriptions = trait_descriptions.\

subject: Defines a Credentials class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-18 14:04:31.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/cb12cb99f03242ac2205c967396cbd58444ce285', 'message': 'Defines a Credentials class

Multiversion auth part4

WIP - unit tests TBD

Introduces a Credential class.
Using Credentials, it becomes transparent for client managers
and tests which auth version is being used.
Defines a get_default_credentials utils, which is the overall
sole responsible for reading credentials from CONF.
Defines a get_credentials, which buils V2 or V3 credentials
based on configuration. Adds domain to configuration.
Credentials can be filled-in using auth provider, an identity
admin client is not needed to obtain user_id and tenant_id.

Credentials are not used in tests yet. Verified via unit test.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: I5f8ab7ef37c99d2c2425b8487490e3517cfce7ed

commit_message:
Defines a Credentials class

Multiversion auth part4

Introduces a Credential class.
Base class and V2 credentials are defined. V3 in the next patch.
Using Credentials, it becomes transparent for client managers and
tests which auth version is being used.
Defines a get_default_credentials utils, which is solely responsible
for reading credentials from CONF.
Defines a get_credentials, which builds V2 credentials
based on configuration.

Credentials are not used in tests yet, only by AuthProvider.
AuthProvider supports dict credentials in this patch for
backwards compatibility. Credentials are verified via unit test.

Partially implements: bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: I5f8ab7ef37c99d2c2425b8487490e3517cfce7ed
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/87/74387/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class InvalidCredentials(TempestException): message = "Invalid Credentials"

Currently, the api endpoint function for listing
packages returns all packages by default.  This
commit adds a new 'include_disabled' parameter
which, when specified by an admin as 'True',
results in the packages search results including
disabled packages from all users in addition to
all enabled packages.

When the include_disabled parameter is specified
'True' by non-admins, the search will include
both all enabled packages and only the disabled
packages owned by the searcher.

If a non-admin specifies 'True' for the
include_disabled paramater AND also specifies
the 'owned' parameter, then the non-admin gets
all of their own packages, both enabled and
disabled.

This commit effectively disables the 'owned'
parameter for admin users.  It is the only way
to make the package search API function
usable for both generating views of packages
for deployment as well as views of packages

commit_message:
Add include_disabled param to pkg search

Currently, the api endpoint function for listing
packages returns all packages by default.  This
commit adds a new 'include_disabled' parameter
which, when specified by an admin as 'True',
results in the packages search results including
disabled packages from all users in addition to
all enabled packages.

When the include_disabled parameter is specified
'True' by non-admins, the search will include
both all enabled packages (public and owned), plus
only the disabled packages owned by the searcher.

If a non-admin specifies 'True' for the
include_disabled paramater AND also specifies
the 'owned' parameter, then the non-admin gets
all of their own packages, public and private,
both enabled and disabled.

This commit effectively disables the 'owned'
parameter for admin users.  It is the only way
to make the package search API function
usable for both generating views of packages
for deployment as well as views of packages
for editing packages.

Change-Id: I28dfc49e1559dd9f0a87b89936df3e4b5c938264
Partial-Bug: #1307963
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/21/89721/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
RHEL should have default provider

On RHEL-7 systemd is used and the default provider (service I suppose)
works on older releases too.

Change-Id: I4cb378350cb8de7f7c1ce1c3caacabbe682227da

commit_message:
Verify certificate API response attributes

Now most attributes of Nova v2/v3 APIs are not checked in Tempest,
and this patch adds some tests which check these attributes to block
the backward incompatibility change in the future.

This patch adds the checks of certificate API responses.
The response body of this API is the following:
{
    'certificate': {
        'data': 'Certificate:\n    Data:\n        Version:...',
        'private_key': '-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\nM...'
    }
}

Partially implements blueprint nova-api-attribute-test

Change-Id: I5e97cfb5be56b4fa8de5d7262375b5b5b6de1b2a

commit_message:
Ceilometer install: ensure keystone authentication

Make sure that the auth_strategy option is set to keystone during
ceilometer installation.

Change-Id: I6be4f9ac741e29169792874df857a7e51f0e3289
Closes-Bug: #1310801
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/46/90446/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>Configure the collector dispatcher:</para> <para>Configure the Telemetry service to authenticate with the Identity Service.</para> <para>Set the <option>auth_strategy</option> value to <literal>keystone</literal> in the <filename>/etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf</filename> file:</para> <screen os="centos;rhel;fedora;opensuse;sles"><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf \ DEFAULT auth_strategy keystone</userinput></screen> <programlisting language="ini" os="debian;ubuntu">[DEFAULT] ... auth_strategy = keystone</programlisting> </step> <step>

commit_message:
Adding undercloud ceilometer

-making whole Undercloud UI and dependent elements optional
 but included by default
-adding Undercloud Ceilometer that will collect statistics
 about Overcloud nodes, via SNMP
-adding SNMPd elements to all overcloud nodes

Change-Id: I31a577e298a9d0253e9b735be962fc384edc7b22

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-24 19:45:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/blazar/commit/345e669bba8289e65308ed259a41ee09620feb7f', 'message': 'Set osapi_compute_extensions default value

the osapi_compute_extensions configuration option from lib/nova.

commit_message:
Set osapi_compute_extensions default value

The Devstack commit 3317437caca5eb769ab4c6d3ea7c5d3e062517e2 removed
the osapi_compute_extensions configuration option from lib/nova.
This caused that when our Devstack implementation sets this
configuration option, the default value were missed. This default value
is important because is the one that loads all the default Nova
extensions, which causes a lot of HTTP 404 at Nova API.
For this reason, our Devstack implementation was modified in order to
set this default value when this option is not set by any other project.

Change-Id: I04698643ac00b4b52b05f28a6c46522991734fc4
Closes-Bug: #1312368
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/blazar refs/changes/06/90206/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ACTUAL_OSAPI_COMPUTE_EXTENSIONS=$(iniget_multiline $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT osapi_compute_extension) if [[ -z "$ACTUAL_OSAPI_COMPUTE_EXTENSIONS" ]]; then iniset $NOVA_CONF DEFAULT osapi_compute_extension "nova.api.openstack.compute.contrib.standard_extensions" fi

commit_message:
Added docker container refs

Docker refs allow for download and build
of docker images to ship with Fuel ISO
blueprint fuel-containerization-of-services
Change-Id: I8d0ab5510b5b14d94aadc65d004d3e333f5ff39b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/00/85400/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash -e BUILD_DIR="$PWD/../build" mkdir -p $BUILD_DIR/docker $BUILD_DIR/isoroot fuellibrepo="https://github.com/stackforge/fuel-library.git" #TODO refactor to check ENV for this value fuellibref="origin/master" FUELLIB_GERRIT_URL="https://review.openstack.org/stackforge/fuel-library" declare -A containers if [ -z "$1" ] ; then for candidate in *; do [ -d "$candidate" ] && containers+="$candidate " done else containers=$@ fi mkdir -p $BUILD_DIR/docker for container in $containers; do . $container/config #config has these vars #dockerrepo=git://repo.git #dockerref=refs/changes/61/83061/4 #puppetrepo=git://repo.git #puppetref=$(cat $container/puppet) rm -rf "$BUILD_DIR/docker/$container" #mkdir -p "$BUILD_DIR/docker/$container" #git init docker-$container git clone --depth 1 --branch $dockerref $dockerrepo $BUILD_DIR/docker/$container #pushd "$BUILD_DIR/docker/$container" #git checkout $dockerref #popd if [ "$puppetref" != "none" -a "$puppetref" != "same" ]; then rm -rf $BUILD_DIR/docker/puppet if grep -q "refs/changes" <<< "$puppetref"; then git clone --depth 1 --branch master $puppetrepo $BUILD_DIR/docker/puppet pushd $BUILD_DIR/docker/puppet git fetch $FUELLIB_GERRIT_URL $puppetref git cherry-pick FETCH_HEAD popd else git clone --depth 1 --branch $puppetref $puppetrepo $BUILD_DIR/docker/puppet fi rm -rf "$BUILD_DIR/docker/$container/etc/puppet/modules" mkdir -p "$BUILD_DIR/docker/$container/etc/puppet/modules" cp -R $BUILD_DIR/docker/puppet/deployment/puppet/* $BUILD_DIR/docker/$container/etc/puppet/modules #git init puppet #git remote add puppet $puppetrepo #git fetch puppet $puppetref #git clone $puppetrepo . #git checkout $puppetref #git checkout FETCH_HEAD elif [ "$puppetref" = "same" ];then mkdir -p "$BUILD_DIR/docker/$container/etc/puppet/modules" pushd "$BUILD_DIR/docker/$container/etc/puppet/modules" git init puppet git remote add puppet $fuellibrepo git fetch puppet $fuellibref git checkout FETCH_HEAD popd fi pushd $BUILD_DIR/docker/ docker build -rm -t fuel/$container $container #Run once to create an exportable container container_id=$(docker run -d fuel/$container echo export only) mkdir -p "${BUILD_DIR}/isoroot/docker/" docker export $container_id | gzip -c > "${BUILD_DIR}/isoroot/docker/${container}.tar.gz" popd done

commit_message:
Add SwiftSortingMethod parameter

Add SwiftSortingMethod to notCompute0Config and SwiftStorage0Config
swift metadata.

This parameter is used by swift to determine how
storage nodes are chosen. Valid values are shuffle (choose nodes at random),
timing (by using timing measurements), or affinity (by using an explicit match).

The default SwiftSortingMethod is shuffle.

The following is added to tripleo-image-elements proxy-server.conf:

{{#swift.sorting-method}}
sorting_method = {{swift.sorting-method}}
{{/swift.sorting-method}}

See https://review.openstack.org/83323

Change-Id: I3c1f2a010129c7a8a442695257fd742edf6545e3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/70/84470/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SwiftSortingMethod: Default: shuffle Description: Determines how nodes are sorted. Values are shuffle, timing or affinity Type: String NoEcho: true sorting-method: Ref: SwiftSortingMethod

commit_message:
Allow to set seed node cpus and memory

Increasing the number of cpus and the memory for the seed vm,
has impact in the time needed to boot the undercloud when the
images are built compressed  (without the -u option).
Booting times of the undercloud are reduced about 35% (More data
in the bug comments)

This can be done with the SEED_CPU and SEED_MEM (MB) env.
variables. (Defaults to 1 CPU and 2048M RAM, as current ones)

Partial-Bug: #1295732

Change-Id: Iac68701408696ae1eb598bbf7e2a3d0ad877e116
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/78/84078/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: setup-seed-vm $SEED_ARGS -c SEED_CPU=${SEED_CPU:-1} -m SEED_MEM=$((1024 * ${SEED_MEM:-2048}))

commit_message:
transformer: Add aggregator transformer

This adds a transformer aggregate counters until a threshold and/or a
retention time and then flushing them out.

Change-Id: If4a950e585fe5309ddec58ed2c9a92928ac1acb2
Co-Authored-By: Jordan Pittier <jordan.pittier@cloudwatt.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/38/87238/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: AGGREGATE_ATTRIBUTE = ['resource_metadata', 'user_id', 'project_id'] class AggregatorTransformer(ScalingTransformer): """Transformer that aggregate sample until a threshold, and then flush them out in the wild. """ def __init__(self, size=1, **kwargs): super(AggregatorTransformer, self).__init__(**kwargs) self.key_attributes = [] self.merged_attribute_policy = {} for field in AGGREGATE_ATTRIBUTE: conf = kwargs.get(field) if conf: if conf not in ['last', 'first']: LOG.warn('%s is unknown (%s), using last' % (field, conf)) conf = 'last' self.merged_attribute_policy[field] = conf else: self.key_attributes.append(field) if size >= 1: self.samples = {} self.size = size def _get_cache_key(self, s): aggregate_key = "-".join([getattr(s, field) for field in self.key_attributes]) #NOTE(sileht): it assumes, a meter always have the same unit/type return "%s-%s-%s" % (s.name, s.resource_id, aggregate_key) def handle_sample(self, context, sample): if self.size >= 1: key = self._get_cache_key(sample) if key not in self.samples: self.samples[key] = self._convert(sample) else: self.samples[key].volume += self._scale(sample) for field in self.merged_attribute_policy: if self.merged_attribute_policy[field] == 'last': setattr(self.samples[key], field, getattr(sample, field)) else: return sample def flush(self, context): if len(self.samples) >= self.size: x = self.samples.values() self.samples = {} return x return []

commit_message:
Get use-pip-manifest to ignore '-e' dev versions

This patch gets use-pip-manifest to also ignore pip entries
introduced with the -e specifier, as they are editable
development versions, rather than versioned packages.

Change-Id: I581eebb3db5595d9b0e6154f9f78e19ccf0bca6b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/44/87244/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # also dev versions listed via the -e (editable) option sed -i "s/^\(-e .*\)$/# \1/g" $manifest

commit_message:
RabbitMQ - Ensure node name comparisons are case insensitive

Heat generated hostnames can have uppercase letters, while cloud-init
will convert these to all lowercase. By ensuring comparisons are case
insensitive, the `if [ "$MASTER" = "$LOCAL" ]` etc tests succeed.

Change-Id: I3806f5e8beb3e9043e1d1c88bcdfe525af940971
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-image-elements refs/changes/57/85557/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: LOCAL=$(hostname -s|tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')NODES=$(os-apply-config --key rabbit.nodes --type raw --key-default '' | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]' | sed 's/,/\n/g')

commit_message:
orchestration api add basic volume resource test

Adds a basic test which provides coverage for the OS::Cinder::Volume
resource, we just create and delete a volume and check the stack
details match those obtained directly via the cinder API.

Change-Id: Ia096f99c0c5decfafc144fe5afb47b6c871a218d

commit_message:
orchestration api refactor access to stack outputs

Refactor test_server_cfn_init access to stack outputs so it uses
a new wrapper which gets the stack and returns the requested
output.  This provides a useful function which can be used in
other tests which parse the stack output.  Since we no longer
need to get the stack in test_server_cfn_init, remove the gets
and duplicate checks for CREATE_COMPLETE.

Change-Id: If1d0990ac9467b6e9778e4444b2ec5fc0f1e44e7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/52/84852/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Improved logs for add/remove security group rules.

Added more details - protocol and port information to AUDIT log
messages on add/remove rule actions for security groups.

Closes-Bug: #1154303

commit_message:
Refactored cleaner and added cleanup/utils

Moved context/cleaner to its own package, called cleanup, under
benchmark.context and renamed it to cleanup.py. To improve cohesion,
splitted benchmark/utils.py into two, and all cleanup related functions
were moved to benchmark.context.cleanup.utils. Removed cleanup function
in cleanup.py and references to it, since it's obsolete. Finally updated
all references and unit tests accordingly to reflect the changes.

bp benchmark-context-cleanup-refactor
Change-Id: Iaffc4e35e21b734a7b4cb77ffaf810112054ebae

commit_message:
Change agent_id to id in the response of agent API

When creating a new entity, most APIs return a response which includes
"id" to represent a new id. However, only agent API returns "agent_id"
as a new entity. This behavior seems inconsistent from the viewpoint
of whole Nova API.

This patch changes it to "id".

Change-Id: I9df2b834240ce614a71317d86af5732222f1c3d8
Closes-Bug: #1306381

commit_message:
Document INI format for Config Reference

Document the format of OpenStack configuration files - INI format.

Add an entry to the glossary for INI.

Change-Id: I4d0e16b36d1e261b223b3f842dbdac5fcfa770ab
Closes-Bug: #1310457
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/94/90594/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <glossterm>INI</glossterm> <glossdef> <para> The OpenStack configuration files use an INI format to describe options and their values. It consists of sections and key value pairs. </para> </glossdef> </glossentry> <glossentry>

commit_message:
Add argument to curl for following redirects

GitHub redirects location of `get-pip.py` script.
"-L"/"--location" argument should be added to curl command for correct work.

Change-Id: I402bcbc244248187a3122f3ac9d65e3439423724
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/71/90571/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: curl -L -o ${GETPIPPY_FILE} ${PIP_SECURE_LOCATION}

commit_message:
Fix requirements nova notify service tenant-id

We need waiting while keystone service and it's haproxy section
stay to UP state

Closes-Bug: #1312614

Change-Id: Iae49ef3aa58d33207d4f26262f426fa9d4bec2c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/94/90394/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Neutron_config<||> -> Exec['get_service_tenant_ID'] File['/root/openrc'] -> Exec['get_service_tenant_ID'] Keystone_tenant["${nova_admin_tenant_name}"] -> Exec['get_service_tenant_ID'] Openstack::Ha::Haproxy_service<| title == 'keystone-1' |> -> Exec['get_service_tenant_ID'] Openstack::Ha::Haproxy_service<| title == 'keystone-2' |> -> Exec['get_service_tenant_ID'] exec {'get_service_tenant_ID': # Imitate tries & try_sleep for 'onlyif' tries => 10, # by using couple of execs try_sleep => 3, # WITHOUT refreshonly option command => "bash -c \"source /root/openrc ; keystone tenant-list\" | grep \"${nova_admin_tenant_name}\" > /tmp/services", path => '/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin' } # do not use refreshonly and notify here -- it leads to double execution 'onlyif' command exec {'insert_service_tenant_ID': onlyif => "head -n1 /tmp/services | awk -F'|' '{print \$2}' | grep -xEe '\\s*[[:xdigit:]]+\\s*' > /tmp/serviceid", } Exec['get_service_tenant_ID'] -> Exec['insert_service_tenant_ID'] -> Service<| title == 'neutron-server' |>
deleted_lines: Neutron_config<||> -> exec {'insert service tenant ID': onlyif => "bash -c \"source /root/openrc ; keystone tenant-list\" | grep \"${nova_admin_tenant_name}\" | awk -F'|' '{print \$2}' > /tmp/serviceid; head -n1 /tmp/serviceid | grep -xEe '\s*[a-zA-Z0-9]+\s*'", } -> Service<| title == 'neutron-server' |> Keystone_tenant["${nova_admin_tenant_name}"] -> Exec['insert service tenant ID']

commit_message:
Storwize/SVC driver detach volume failed

If config two backends on the same storage, but the protocol is
different, one is FC and the other is iSCSI,  that will create two
hosts on the storage.

When detaching the volume which is attached to the iSCSI host, the
driver will get FC host by default, that causes volume status keeps
'detaching'.

Change-Id: Idbdb3861574197549625b4a6b6141197e42857ff
Closes-Bug: #1310559
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/62/89462/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # maybe two hosts on the storage, one is for FC and the other for # iSCSI, so get host according to protocol vol_opts = self._get_vdisk_params(volume['volume_type_id']) connector = connector.copy() if vol_opts['protocol'] == 'FC': connector.pop('initiator', None) elif vol_opts['protocol'] == 'iSCSI': connector.pop('wwnns', None) connector.pop('wwpns', None)

commit_message:
Fixes "bad format" in replicator for valid hosts

Due to a bad regex, the glance-replicator tool rejects any source or
target host:port combination that contains a period. As a result, only
hostnames without periods can be used.

This fix expands the host/port checks to:
  - allow periods in hostnames
  - allow and verify IPv6 addr/port pairs (i.e., [fe80::f00d:face]:1234)
  - allow and verify IPv4 addr/port pairs (i.e., 172.17.17.2:1234)
  - sanity-check port numbers

This also includes extensive tests for each component of the parsing,
and adds network_utils to openstack-common.conf.

Change-Id: I94fdd7a57a4cb0aa5d79f66d68be159d1f1266d1
Closes-Bug: #1216247

commit_message:
Remove email as optional query parameter

Since in keystone it was decided that a user's email won't be taken as a
first class attribute, it is then needed to get it off the API as it is
not an attribute with which you can filter users.

Change-Id: I4b481d2b23013d23060cfae5f4d442d5c8024fec

commit_message:
Enable building of translated manuals

This is the initial setup to build translated manuals. For now only the
api-quick-start is build.

This needs openstack-doc-tools version 0.13.

Change-Id: I140b8007d76bda5f436cbd80e77b890852c71827

commit_message:
Add backup size validation test group

Reasons:
 - users are able to pass backup to restoring
   call that has size bigger than
   volume/disk can handle.
Changes:
 - adding validation to backup size according
   to volume size or flavor root disk.
 - test int group proposed.

Change-Id: I08b7b9c09d03412ee36760f293fa61c433840ec7
Closes-Bug: #1304603

commit_message:
Support new format in policy.json in cinder

Merged in the openstack-common policy codes from nova to keep the new
format in policy.json in cinder supported in the same way with that in
nova and other components. The cinder-specific policy and test bits are
also updated for the new format. The policy.json is just changed in the
format.

Implements: blueprint cinder-new-policy.json-format
Closes-Bug: #1279263
Change-Id: I129a4be90ce37ceb05fdc9c0ba9116b7e7f115b7

commit_message:
Add check for import StringIO or cStringIO

to keep Python 3.x compatibility, import StringIO or cStringIO
is not allowed.

Change-Id: I4418a409e4440186e8d71138a75b1c84244c4903
Closes-Bug: #1280100
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/31/77031/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: IMPORT_StringIO_RE = re.compile(r"^\s*(?:import|from) StringIO") IMPORT_cStringIO_RE = re.compile(r"^\s*(?:import|from) cStringIO")def import_no_StringIO(logical_line): """Check for "import cStringIO" T107 """ if (IMPORT_StringIO_RE.match(logical_line) or IMPORT_cStringIO_RE.match(logical_line)): yield (0, "N319: import cStringIO/StringIO is not compatible " "with python3 and not allowed") register(import_no_StringIO)

Use six.moves cStringIO instead of cStringIO

to keep Python 3.x compatibility, use six.moves.cStringIO to
replace StringIO

Closes-Bug: #1280964

commit_message:
Remove conversion debug message

Removing unnecessary debug message confusing the user to
think the error is fatal. Instead just let it pass silently
to avoid confusion. The debug message wasnt adding much
value anyway.

Closes-Bug: #1306280

Change-Id: I03420311f0a6ec77d68b750afce3c4110ccffecf

Make REBUILD_PRESERVE_EPHEMERAL the default

We have it as the default in tripleo-heat-templates already, so this
is a matter of consistency.

commit_message:
Make sure NetworkInterfaces and SubnetId updatable

We should make the properties 'NetworkInterfaces' and 'SubnetId'
updatable for AWS::EC2::Instance resource, so we can update the networks
for an instance.

Change-Id: I4a475fee6416696558807c189473a90d7517cfc0
Closes-Bug: #1280151

find matches and remove them from old and new ifaces not_updated_ifaces = [] for iface in old_network_ifaces: if iface in new_network_ifaces: new_network_ifaces.remove(iface) not_updated_ifaces.append(iface) for iface in not_updated_ifaces: old_network_ifaces.remove(iface) checkers = [] checkers.append(checker) if self.NETWORK_INTERFACES in prop_diff: new_network_ifaces = prop_diff.get(self.NETWORK_INTERFACES) old_network_ifaces = self.properties.get(self.NETWORK_INTERFACES) subnet_id = ( prop_diff.get(self.SUBNET_ID) or self.properties.get(self.SUBNET_ID)) security_groups = self._get_security_groups() if not server: server = self.nova().servers.get(self.resource_id) # if there is entrys in old_network_ifaces and new_network_ifaces, # remove the same entrys from old and new ifaces if old_network_ifaces and new_network_ifaces: self._remove_matched_ifaces(old_network_ifaces, new_network_ifaces) if old_network_ifaces: for iface in old_network_ifaces: checker = scheduler.TaskRunner( server.interface_detach, iface['NetworkInterfaceId']) checkers.append(checker) if new_network_ifaces: for iface in old_network_ifaces: checker = scheduler.TaskRunner( server.interface_attach, iface['NetworkInterfaceId'], None, None) checkers.append(checker) # if new_network_iface is [] or is None, we should attach # first free port, according to similar behavior during # instance creation else: checker = scheduler.TaskRunner(server.interface_attach, None, None, None) checkers.append(checker) # if the interfaces not come from property 'NetworkInterfaces', # the situation is somewhat complex, so to detach the old ifaces, # and then attach the new ones. else: interfaces = server.interface_list() for iface in interfaces: checker = scheduler.TaskRunner(server.interface_detach, iface.port_id) checkers.append(checker) nics = self._build_nics(new_network_ifaces, security_groups=security_groups, subnet_id=subnet_id) if not nics: checker = scheduler.TaskRunner(server.interface_attach, None, None, None) checkers.append(checker) else: for nic in nics: checker = scheduler.TaskRunner( server.interface_attach, nic['port-id'], None, None) checkers.append(checker) if checkers: checkers[0].start() return checkers

commit_message:
Remove test_create_server_response

If enable_instance_password is set to False in nova.conf, the response
of "create a server" API does not contain AdminPass/admin_password.
In addition, the response already is checked with JSON schema definition.
So test_create_server_response became unnecessary.

Change-Id: Id62a8d447c36eaf0b1f64a93929c4cfa2c20e2ae
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/81/86781/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix start_timestamp/end_timestamp in alarm-history

Currently, ceilometer cannot support start_timestamp/end_timestamp in
query field of alarm-history.
This patch enable the two query filters as its presentation.

Change-Id: I98dce9e38f07fd9cc938b4cea4d5ea70bb58a0e8
Closes-bug: #1291171

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-03 03:54:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5212ce567d6fa5ffa5d20f46b9952f437a5ad17c', 'message': "Keep Migration status in automatic confirm-resize

if instance.vm_state == vm_states.RESIZED:

will fail because migration status already updated

User is able to do the migration operations when they found erro

commit_message:
Keep Migration status in automatic confirm-resize

function in compute/manager.py _poll_unconfirmed_resizes
will translate the migrate status from finished to error
whenever it find a problem , consider following case

1) _poll_unconfirmed_resizes running, it found several migrations to be confirmed
2) user want to delete an instance ,its task state will be changed to DELETING
3) _poll_unconfirmed_resized will found the task state is not None,
   it will make the migration error status
4) following code in _delete
if instance.vm_state == vm_states.RESIZED:
                self._confirm_resize_on_deleting(context, instance)
will fail because migration status already updated

User is able to do the migration operations when they found erro
so we don't need to handle this kind of error for them

Change-Id: I1981f4c2eaad05d64934031494f7b5d3f5b5d098
Closes-Bug: #1301696
